page.title: 18THE MINER'S STRIKE
page.content: During the years 1984/1985 there was a miner's {strike.} It had a great effect on me and my family, there was no money coming into the house so I had no pocket money. My mum and my dad had no new clothes but my sister and I did. Nearly every day my dad went picketing for about three or four hours, some mornings he went for longer. Each week my dad or mum went to the local club for a {food {parcel}in which you got things like tinned beans, a packet of rice and sometimes a bit of meat or sausages. At one point we nearly had a cupboard full of tinned tomatoes. Every day on the news there were reports of { {police}on horses hitting striking miners with their batons and then the pickets throwing stones at policemen. All over the country there was violence between police and {pickets.}
